The world s largest artificial intelligence summit opened to packed halls and long queues [ ]

The project, spread across 39 acres, will focus on sustainable and energy-efficient cooling solutions, an official statement said.  The [ ]

articles.summary: The Allahabad High Court ruled that a district magistrate's certificate confirms a transgender person's gender for passport issuance, without needing further medical proof.

articles.title: Can't force dad's caste on child raised by single mom: Bombay HC
articles.summary: The Bombay High Court ruled that a child raised solely by her mother cannot be forced to adopt her father's surname and caste. The court emphasized that a single mother's role in a child's civic identity is constitutional, not charitable. State formats should reflect welfare, not moral judgments, and school records must accurately represent lived guardianship.

articles.title: Explained | RBI to tighten lending norms for brokers from April 1 — key changes and impact
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will mandate full collateral for banks lending to capital market intermediaries from April 1, 2026, tightening exposure norms and prohibiting proprietary trading funding.

articles.title: 'US tariff cut may lift GDP by 20-30 bps', say economists
articles.summary: India's economy is set for a boost as the US lowers tariffs on Indian goods. This move is expected to increase India's GDP by 20-30 basis points next fiscal year. Key sectors like gems and jewellery, textiles, and marine products will see improved exports. The rupee is also likely to stabilize with increased foreign investment.

articles.title: Absolut Vodka maker Pernod Ricard considers listing India business: Report
articles.summary: French drinks maker Pernod Ricard is exploring a separate listing for its Indian business. The company is in preliminary talks with advisors about the move. Pernod Ricard is a major player in India's alcohol market. This development comes amid ongoing antitrust cases and alleged liquor regulation violations in India. The company denies any wrongdoing.

articles.title: India gifts Maldives first high-speed ferry for new transport link
articles.summary: India has rolled out a series of transport link services in the Maldives to enhance connectivity. India has reaffirmed its commitment to supporting the Maldives in establishing essential public services and projects that directly benefit communities.

articles.title: Galgotias University staff leave AI Impact Expo after being told to vacate over Chinese robodog row
articles.summary: Galgotias University clarified it did not develop the Robodog shown at AI Impact Summit in New Delhi, but bought it from China's Unitree for academic use, aiming to inspire innovation.

articles.summary: In an interview, she outlines reforms in cracker configuration, supply agreements and carbon strategy to move India up the global chemical value chain.

articles.summary: Large AI models have been commercially rolled out by global players like ChatGPT of OpenAI, Google's Gemini, etc.The minister said investors are also bullish on India and have finalised investment of over Rs 20,000 crore, which will materialise over the next 1-2 years.

articles.title: Delhi’s Bhu-Aadhaar: How 14-Digit ULPIN digital mapping may transform land records
articles.summary: Delhi government launches Bhu-Aadhaar, assigning unique 14-digit ULPINs to land parcels. Rekha Gupta calls it a revolutionary step for Digital India, aiming to reduce disputes and modernise records.

articles.title: FedEx to invest ₹2,500 crore in automated cargo hub at Navi Mumbai airport
articles.summary: FedEx has announced a ₹2,500 crore investment to build a 300,000 sq ft automated air cargo hub at Navi Mumbai International Airport, marking the first cargo operator plan at the greenfield airport.

articles.title: India AI Summit to address job risks, reskilling needs: MeitY Secretary
articles.summary: S Krishnan, Secretary at the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), said several companies have indicated interest in making investment announcements at the summit, adding that while the government has not specifically sought such declarations, announcements are expected.

articles.title: E-Commerce and travel sectors lead in consumer refunds, govt data reveals ₹52 crore returned
articles.summary: India’s National Consumer Helpline resolved 79,521 refund complaints, securing ₹52 crore in refunds, mostly from e-commerce and travel sectors.

articles.title: IMF warns China’s economic policies are causing damage to others
articles.summary: IMF urges China to shift to consumption-led growth, citing wasteful policies, large current-account surplus, undervalued yuan, and deflation concerns. Zhengxin Zhang defends China’s competitiveness.

articles.title: Cash craze: Currency in circulation touches record Rs 40 lakh crore
articles.summary: The amount of cash circulating in the economy has hit an all-time peak of Rs 40 lakh crore in January, after rising 11.1% year-on-year. Yet, interestingly, the cash-to-GDP ratio has dipped, suggesting that digital payments are playing a much bigger role than before.

articles.title: Sarvam rivals ChatGPT, Claude with AI models customised for India
articles.summary: The launch of Sarvam AI models is seen as a step toward developing a “sovereign AI” ecosystem within India.

articles.title: India’s next big power move is set to unfold in the Bay of Bengal
articles.summary: India's ambitious Great Nicobar infrastructure project has received a green light. This mega project, centered around a new transshipment port, aims to boost India's role in global shipping. It will reduce reliance on foreign ports and strengthen India's strategic presence near vital sea lanes.

articles.summary: Shubhanshu Shukla, Rakesh Sharma outline roadmap for aspiring astronauts in India

articles.summary: Nabha Power owns and operates a 1,400 MW (2x700 MW) supercritical coal-fired thermal power plant at Rajpura in Patiala district, Punjab.

articles.title: AMD, TCS launch ‘Helios’ to power India’s AI infrastructure push with 200 MW capacity
articles.summary: AMD and Tata Consultancy Services unveil Helios at the India AI Impact Summit, a 200 megawatt AI-first platform via HyperWorld Data Centres, aiming to power India’s next wave of AI innovation.

articles.title: Kenya seeks deeper collaboration with India in AI, critical minerals at AI Impact Summit 2026
articles.summary: Kenya is calling for stronger ties with India in artificial intelligence, chip making, and vital minerals. This push for South-South cooperation was highlighted at the India AI Impact Summit 2026 in New Delhi. Kenya wants to partner with India to build manufacturing capabilities and secure supply chains. The summit aims to turn global AI discussions into real development outcomes.

articles.title: Customer-centric innovation to drive India's $750 billion IT ambition: CP Gurnani
articles.summary: India is ready to scale up to a $750 billion IT industry, driven by artificial intelligence (AI), innovation and companies that deeply understand customer needs, CP Gurnani, former CEO of Tech Mahindra, said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Indian Coast Guard seizes Iran-linked oil tankers amid improved trade relations with US
articles.summary: The Coast Guard said that the vessels were intercepted on February 6, roughly 100 nautical miles west of Mumbai.

articles.title: India's engineering talent becoming AI talent: Adaption Labs founder Sara Hooker
articles.summary: India's engineering talent is rapidly becoming AI talent. The nation contributes to all aspects of artificial intelligence, from data to hardware and algorithms. Innovation is key for the AI ecosystem. Government support is crucial for long-term growth. AI research and product development are now closely linked, with breakthroughs quickly impacting millions.

articles.title: OpenAI partners with IIT Delhi, IIM Ahmedabad, others to build AI-ready talent
articles.summary: OpenAI on Wednesday announced partnerships with leading Indian universities to embed artificial intelligence across management, health, engineering, creative and multidisciplinary education, aiming to build AI-ready talent for a tech-driven economy.

articles.title: Snap's direct revenue hits $1 billion annualised run rate as subscribers top 25 million
articles.summary: Snap said on Wednesday its direct-revenue business has reached $1 ​billion in annualised revenue run ​rate, driven by growth in its Snapchat+ subscription ​service, as the social media company pushes into new income streams beyond advertising.

articles.title: India leapfrogged in mobile internet, same is going to be true for AI: Qualcomm CEO
articles.summary: Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon sees India ready to lead in artificial intelligence. He compares this to India's past success with mobile internet and smartphones. Amon believes AI will bring disruption and create opportunities for India. Qualcomm is excited to support India's growth in AI and its global footprint.

articles.title: India, UK conduct scale-up study of AI-enabled mental health tool for young girls
articles.summary: A significant international project is underway to bring AI-powered mental health support to adolescent girls in rural India. This initiative aims to adapt and scale a digital program, utilising an AI chatbot to address anxiety and low mood.

articles.title: Google announces $30 million science fund; new subsea connectivity initiative
articles.summary: Alphabet and Google chief executive Sundar Pichai on Wednesday outlined an expansive vision for India’s artificial intelligence future, unveiling fresh investments in infrastructure, skilling, public sector partnerships and scientific research, while positioning India as central to Google’s global AI strategy.

articles.title: Microsoft says on pace to invest $50 billion by 2030-end across Global South
articles.summary: In India, the company will train 5.6 million people in 2025 and aims to equip 20 million Indians by 2030, including through Microsoft Elevate for Educators, supporting two million teachers across over two lakh schools.

articles.title: Potential misuse of AI by ‘bad actors’ a worry, says Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis
articles.summary: ​Speaking at the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi, Hassabis also warned that risks related to biosecurity and cybersecurity need urgent attention as artificial intelligence (AI) systems become more powerful.

articles.title: India focused on practical applications of AI to solve population-scale challenges: Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Speaking at a research symposium at the AI Impact Summit, the minister also expressed happiness over the strong participation and optimism shown by young people at an AI Expo on Tuesday.

articles.title: 'Nice to be back': Google CEO Sundar Pichai arrives in India for AI Impact Summit
articles.summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai arrived here in the national capital on Wednesday for the Global AI Impact Summit 2026.

articles.title: India has to translate research into products to build deep tech ecosystem: Kris Gopalakrishnan
articles.summary: India needs to translate its research into tangible products and technology to develop a robust deep tech ecosystem and achieve its long-term goal of becoming a developed nation by 2047, Kris Gopalakrishnan, Chairman of Axilor Ventures and cofounder of Infosys, said on the sidelines of the India AI Impact Summit.

articles.title: India's moment, nation is leading, building technology: Intel India MD on AI Summit
articles.summary: The AI Summit marks a defining moment for India, a stage where the nation is not following key technologies but preparing to lead by building solutions unlike anywhere else in the world, Santhosh Viswanathan, Vice President Managing Director, India Region, Intel said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Difficult, painful to lose exhibits at AI Impact Summit, India will learn, improve: NeoSapien cofounder
articles.summary: After sparking a social media buzz over stolen exhibits at the AI Impact Summit, homegrown wearables startup NeoSapien cofounder and CEO Dhananjay Yadav believes India will learn from the incident and improve.

articles.title: India investing in small AI models for resource efficiency, says Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu
articles.summary: Vembu said that the current trend in India is to focus on models that use fewer resources. He stated, "I think we are investing in lot of the smaller models. Those should be unglamorous right now, but they get the job done." He mentioned the startup Sarvam as an example of a company already launching models with a smaller footprint.

articles.title: India's consumer inflation estimated at 4.3% in FY27, up from 2.5% in FY26: Crisil
articles.summary: Consumer inflation in India is set to climb to 4.3 percent in fiscal 2027. This rise follows an estimated 2.5 percent in fiscal 2026. Food inflation will normalize from current low levels. Changes in the Consumer Price Index basket will limit the overall increase. Non-food inflation and core inflation are expected to help restrain the rise.

articles.title: India keen to diversify crude oil, coking coal sources; eyes high-quality US supplies: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India aims to diversify its crude oil and coking coal imports, expressing interest in high-quality US coking coal. The nation also seeks US technology like GPUs for AI and data center equipment. India plans to purchase USD 500 billion in goods from America over five years. This trade deal opens opportunities for Indian firms in labor-oriented goods and technology services.

articles.title: India's sugar output likely to reduce
articles.summary: India's sugar production is projected to dip below earlier expectations, primarily due to heavy rainfall affecting sugarcane yields in major growing regions. This downturn could lead to a decrease in the country's sugar exports, providing a potential buffer for global sugar prices.

articles.title: Gujarat govt presents Rs 4.08 lakh crore Budget; big push to tourism, sports infrastructure
articles.summary: Gujarat Budget 2026: Gujarat unveiled a Rs 4.08 lakh crore Budget for 2026-27. The focus is on boosting tourism and developing sports infrastructure for the 2030 Commonwealth Games. Ahmedabad will be developed as an 'Olympic Ready City'. Significant funds are allocated for sports complexes and tourism promotion, including the Statue of Unity and Ambaji. The Budget offers a tax rebate on electric vehicles.

articles.title: Niramala Sitharaman pitches India as a growth hotspot to Norwegian CEOs, eyes deeper trade ties
articles.summary: During a strategic meeting in the heart of Oslo, India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman engaged with top Norwegian business leaders and investors. She highlighted India’s robust trade infrastructure and portrayal as one of the fastest-growing economies globally. Conversations pivoted around lucrative investment avenues in pivotal areas such as renewable energy and rare earth materials.

articles.title: India's oilmeals exports fall 42 pc in January on weak soyabean, rapeseed shipments
articles.summary: India's oilmeal exports saw a significant drop of 42 percent in January. Shipments of soyabean meal and rapeseed meal plunged, impacting the overall figures. Ricebran extraction, however, showed a surge. This decline affects animal feed supplies. Key buyers include China, South Korea, Bangladesh, and Germany. Processors awaited new crop supplies for rapeseed meal.

articles.title: India's textile and apparel exports down by 3.75% in January, outlook improves now with India US interim deal
articles.summary: India's textile and apparel exports saw a dip in January. High tariffs from the United States impacted shipments. However, a recent reduction in these tariffs is expected to boost export competitiveness. This change should support a recovery in textile and apparel shipments in the coming months. The sector's share in India's total exports also saw a decline.

articles.title: Gold, silver import surge pushes India’s January trade deficit to 3-month high of $34.68 billion
articles.summary: Surging gold and silver imports widened India’s January trade deficit to $34.68 billion. Imports jumped 19% while exports barely grew, with services offering limited relief amid weak global demand.

articles.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 5% in January, higher rise for females
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in January, reaching 5%. Joblessness rose more significantly for women compared to men. Rural unemployment edged up, while urban unemployment also increased. The labour force participation rate experienced a minor dip. Youth unemployment also saw a rise, primarily driven by female joblessness.

articles.title: Wholesale inflation touches 10-month high of 1.8% in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation reached a 10-month peak of 1.81 percent in January. This rise was fueled by higher costs for food, non-food articles, and manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw its first reading under a new series. Economists noted a gradual increase in inflation since October 2025. The core WPI segment showed a significant jump.

articles.title: India’s trade deficit widens to $34.68 billion in January as gold imports rise
articles.summary: India's trade deficit surged in January, driven by higher gold and silver imports. Merchandise exports saw a slight dip. However, overall goods and services exports are projected to exceed $860 billion for the fiscal year. Trade pacts with the UAE and EU offer future export growth opportunities. US tariff reductions are expected to boost Indian exports.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises marginally to 5% in January
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate rose to 5% in January. This increase was primarily seen in rural areas. The joblessness rate edged up from 3.9% to 4.2% in villages. Urban unemployment also saw a slight rise. Labour force participation and worker population ratios declined. Seasonal factors and post-harvest slack contributed to the rural slowdown. Urban areas remained stable.

articles.title: China's Russian oil imports to hit new record in February as India cuts back
articles.summary: China's Russian oil imports are set to reach a new record high in February, surpassing January's figures. Independent refiners are increasingly purchasing discounted Russian crude as India reduces its purchases, driven by concerns over potential U.S. strikes on Iran and the relative competitiveness of Russian supplies.

articles.title: India wholesale inflation at 9-month high of 1.81% in January; up from 0.83% in December
articles.summary: In January, India witnessed a surge in wholesale price inflation, hitting a nine-month high of 1.81%. This uptrend can be attributed to escalating costs across basic metals, manufactured goods, and agricultural sectors, with food inflation also on the rise. Concurrently, retail inflation edged up to 2.75%, driven by the rising costs of food and precious metals.

articles.title: A bite too big? Orchard anxiety for farmers as US apples could crowd Indian shelves
articles.summary: Apple cultivators in India stand at a crossroads as a recent trade agreement with the US and a surge in imported fruits jeopardise their existence. The local apple sector is grappling with soaring logistics expenses and significant losses post-harvest. There's an urgent call for transformative strategies to streamline supply chains and enhance productivity.

articles.title: India's sugar exports reach 2.01 lakh tonnes till February in 2026 MY: AISTA
articles.summary: India has exported over 200,000 tonnes of sugar by February in the current marketing year. The United Arab Emirates is the leading destination for these shipments. The government has approved a total of 2 million tonnes for export this year. This includes an additional 500,000 tonnes recently permitted. Sugar production is projected to increase significantly.

articles.title: Fear of the unknown: Is India's $250 billion IT industry facing its Kodak moment?
articles.summary: Indian IT stocks are experiencing significant declines, sparking fears of an AI-driven "Kodak moment." While some analysts warn of direct exposure to AI-induced displacement, others argue the market is oversimplifying the role of IT services. Experts suggest AI could paradoxically unlock massive modernization opportunities, potentially fueling the industry's next growth phase.

articles.title: This Indian smallcap fund beating 93% of peers bets on internet value stocks
articles.summary: Bandhan Small Cap Fund, which outperformed 93% of peers last year, is investing in beaten-down Indian internet firms like Paytm and Info Edge. The fund manager sees opportunity in unpopular value stocks with potential for significant gains, even amidst market volatility and regulatory challenges. The portfolio also favors undervalued textile and real estate sectors.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk | New-age traders prefer derivatives, algos over traditional investing: Kiran Jani of Jainam Broking
articles.summary: Indian markets are currently range-bound. A notable shift is occurring from traditional investing to fast-paced, technology-led trading. New-age traders are embracing derivatives and algorithmic strategies. Long-term investors continue to rely on earnings growth and SIPs. FII selling persists, but DII inflows provide support. Sector rotation is evident, with some sectors showing signs of overheating.

articles.title: Stocks in news: Cochin Shipyard, Bharat Forge, HUL, Dr Reddy's, L&T
articles.summary: Indian markets saw modest gains for a third straight session. Key stocks like Cochin Shipyard and Bharat Forge are in focus. Cochin Shipyard secured new orders. Bharat Forge is exploring technology collaborations. Hindustan Unilever plans manufacturing expansion. Dr Reddy's acquired specialty brand trademarks. L T announced a venture for AI factory infrastructure.

articles.title: Metal stocks glitter on Dalal Street, eye stronger March quarter
articles.summary: Indian metal stocks are performing strongly. Prices for steel and non-ferrous metals have risen significantly. This is due to increased demand, government policies, and limited supply. Steel companies are seeing better earnings. Non-ferrous producers also benefit from global price trends and a weaker rupee. The current quarter is typically strong for metal volumes.

articles.title: Not doomsday, AI will ring in modernisation:  C S Venkatakrishnan, Barclays
articles.summary: Barclays CEO C S Venkatakrishnan highlights India's strong growth and digital transformation reshaping its global economic standing. He believes AI will modernize systems rather than eliminate jobs, and the world is entering a sensitive credit cycle after years of cheap borrowing, with geopolitical shifts mirroring the 1970s-80s.

articles.title: A blanket social media ban for kids won’t work for Al: UNICEF’s Thomas Davin
articles.summary: Thomas Davin, UNICEF’s global innovation director, said blanket social media bans won’t work everywhere, as their impact depends on a country’s development and socio-economic conditions. He added that children in developing nations, including India, need access to AI and online services for education and economic security. Davin questioned whether age-based restrictions alone would be effective in India.

articles.title: India’s mobile net playbook can help it leapfrog in AI too
articles.summary: Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon said India has the potential to lead in AI, similar to its success with mobile internet, thanks to its scale, young population, and vibrant mobile ecosystem. He highlighted the importance of sovereign AI and hybrid architectures for context-aware agents. Qualcomm has also launched a $150 million fund to invest in Indian AI startups.

articles.title: India well-placed to scale personal Superintelligence: Meta’s Alexandr Wang
articles.summary: Meta’s new chief AI officer, Alexandr Wang, said India is key for scaling “personal superintelligence” across the company’s platforms, with more Indian consumer AI companies than in the US. The firm plans to deploy AI that works 24/7, understands user goals and acts on their behalf. Wang, who leads Superintelligence Labs, is tasked with bringing a builder’s perspective to Meta’s $14.3 billion AI investments.

articles.title: Sarvam AI to launch its smart wearable in May, partner with HMD for feature phones
articles.summary: Sovereign AI model developer Sarvam plans to launch its made-in-India smart eyewear by May this year, a senior company official said on Wednesday.

articles.title: AI adoption already hitting Irish graduate jobs, finance department says
articles.summary: Early evidence suggests artificial intelligence is ​weakening employment opportunities in ​some parts of Ireland's technology-focused economy, particularly ​for young graduates, research by Ireland's finance department found.

articles.title: Karnataka leads India's AI race, says IT/BT minister Priyank Kharge
articles.summary: Kharge also attended a US-India Business Council roundtable on tech and investment ties, met Finnish MP Timo Harakka to discuss AI and deeptech collaboration, and held talks with Cyprus’s research deputy minister Nicodemos Damianou on using Cyprus as a gateway to Europe for Bengaluru startups and boosting innovation partnerships.

articles.title: India and the world should build only on American AI stack: US AI advisor Sriram Krishnan
articles.summary: Krishnan, the White House senior policy advisor on artificial intelligence, said the US is aiming to become an ‘easy haven’ to do business. However, his remarks stand in contrast to the current challenges faced by non-American businesses and entrepreneurs seeking to operate in the country.

articles.title: IIT-Madras to establish applied AI innovation centre in Dubai
articles.summary: IIT-Madras's Global Research Foundation is launching its first Applied AI Innovation Centre in Dubai. This centre will support six AI startups, aiming to boost economic growth. It will position Dubai as a key hub for AI solutions. The initiative strengthens the India-UAE technology corridor. This collaboration accelerates market access for startups and promotes sustainable innovation.

articles.title: Google CEO interview; Sarvam's launch day
articles.summary: Before his India visit, Google CEO Sundar Pichai spoke to ET about Alphabet's AI investments, Gemini plans and others. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Balancing AI and copyright; Adani's $100B bet
articles.summary: Day 2 of the India AI Impact Summit featured additional announcements, sessions, and policy discussions focused on emerging technology. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: School assembly news headlines Feb 4: Top national, international, sports, business update and thought of the day
articles.summary: India and the US finalized a significant trade deal, boosting the rupee and leading to discussions on oil procurement and tariff adjustments. Meanwhile, national headlines include political developments, a tragic incident involving a Bengaluru CEO, and aviation safety concerns. Internationally, Russia's assault on Ukraine continues, and Pakistan faces challenges with defense deals and internal security.

articles.title: Brent crude could hit $75 on US-Iran tensions, says Peter McGuire
articles.summary: Peter McGuire, CEO of Trading.com, expects heightened volatility across commodities, with a flight to safety likely supporting the US dollar, gold and silver. He also noted that, without the geopolitical risk premium, underlying fundamentals would point to cheaper crude prices.

articles.title: Nirmala Sitharaman meets Norwegian CEOs to discuss India investment scope
articles.summary: Speaking at the session with 35 Norwegian CEOs and investors in Oslo, FM Nirmala Sitharaman said, 'My official visit to Norway has witnessed engaging and positive discussions on India as an investment destination and the fastest growing major economy of the world.'

articles.title: AI is a 'civilisational change': N Chandrasekaran sees big opportunity for India’s IT
articles.summary: Calling AI a civilisation-scale shift, N Chandrasekaran says enterprise adoption will unlock latent demand, positioning India’s IT services firms for large-scale transformation opportunities.

articles.title: Food Secretary: India's sugar supply "comfortably" placed despite production estimates down by 13 LT
articles.summary: India's sugar production is estimated at 330 LT, with consumption at 290 LT, ensuring surplus. AISTA reports 2.01 LT exports in 2025-26, mainly to UAE, Afghanistan, Djibouti, and Bhutan.

articles.title: Gokaldas Exports expects 12-15% revenue growth in FY27 as US sourcing returns
articles.summary: Gokaldas Exports is expanding in Europe and continuing diversification. It also plans capex of around ₹175 crore over two years and is open to expansion through acquisitions. Management said trade deals and tariff normalisation could support textile exports and jobs growth.

articles.title: Why India’s cash in circulation hit ₹40 lakh crore despite record UPI surge? Check here
articles.summary: India’s currency in circulation hits ₹40 lakh crore, while UPI transactions reach ₹28.3 lakh crore monthly. SBI Research notes digital payments are driving incremental GDP growth amid rising cash.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises to 5% in January 2026
articles.summary: India’s unemployment rate rose to 5% in January 2026, with overall labour force participation rate (LFPR) at 55.9% and worker population ratio (WPR) at 53.1%. Urban and rural workforce participation remained largely stable as did female LFPR, month-on-month.

articles.title: India's trade deficit soars to record high as gold imports surge
articles.summary: For the April–January period, merchandise exports rose 2.22% to $366.63 billion, while imports climbed 7.21% to $649.86 billion, keeping the deficit elevated.

articles.title: Bill Gates meets Andhra CM Naidu in Amaravati ahead of AI Impact Summit; discusses health, agri, and tech
articles.summary: Bill Gates visited Amaravati, met Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu to discuss health, agriculture, and tech collaboration ahead of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 10-month high in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation rose to 1.81% in January from 0.83%, mainly due to higher food prices and increased manufacturing sector costs. Certain kitchen items remain significantly cheaper than a year ago.

articles.title: ‘Extremely concerned’ about global aid cuts: Rockerfeller’s Raj Shah warns of millions of needless deaths
articles.summary: As major countries like the US, UK and France execute deep cuts to their aid budgets and turn a blind eye to climate change, the world will become less capable of handling a pandemic or a major food crisis, Raj Shah, President of the Rockefeller Foundation, said in an interview with CNBC-TV18. He warned that reduced global aid could cause 23 million deaths by 2030, affecting India. However, he saw some hope in private sector participation.

articles.title: Indian CDMO sector in early phase of multi-year growth cycle: Sai Life CEO
articles.summary: Satyanarayana Chava, Founder & CEO Laurus Labs & Krishna Kanumuri, MD & CEO, Sai Life Sciences said the long-term growth outlook for India’s contract development and manufacturing (CDMO) sector remains strong, even as companies continue to see fluctuations in quarterly performance due to the nature of the business.

articles.title: TVS Supply Chain sees defence logistics opportunity as India market expands
articles.summary: Ravi Viswanathan, Managing Director of TVS Supply Chain Solutions, expects defence logistics opportunity to cross ₹2,000 crore over time. The partnership with ALA is currently at the MOU stage, with revenue sharing to be decided project-wise. Defence business is expected to support margin improvement for the company.

articles.title: Stocks get tech boost amid strong economic reports
articles.summary: US stocks climbed as S P 500 rose nearly 1 percent, driven by strong economic data and easing AI disruption fears. Oil jumped, tech and software stocks rebounded, and IPO activity slowed.

articles.title: AI disruption clouds IT outlook; Firstsource only buy: Girish Pai
articles.summary: Girish Pai, Research Analyst-Head of Institutional Equity Research at BOB Capital Markets warns AI could reshape Indian IT services, with uncertain earnings visibility beyond 2026-27 (FY27) and valuations at risk of becoming a value trap.

articles.title: Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam gets 'battery torch' symbol
articles.summary: The Election Commission of India allotted the Battery Torch symbol to Makkal Needhi Maiam for the 2026 Puducherry polls. Kamal Haasan leads MNM, which campaigned for the DMK-led INDIA bloc.

articles.title: Nearly one-fourth of BMC winners face criminal cases, majority are crorepatis, says ADR report
articles.summary: According to the ADR report, party-wise data shows that 33% of winners from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) have declared criminal cases. This is followed by 24% from Shiv Sena and 15% from Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray).

articles.title: Case against Blinkit after police find criminals buying prohibited large knives on app
articles.summary: Delhi Police booked Blinkit for selling illegal knives, seized 50 from Delhi and Gurugram warehouses, and are investigating supply chains.

articles.title: India has the talent, data and policy edge to lead in AI: Industry leaders
articles.summary: Archana Vemulapalli, VP - Global Sales at AMD said India must move from being only a source of human intelligence to becoming a hub for artificial intelligence infrastructure as well. She stressed the importance of partnerships, advanced chips and next-generation compute systems to power AI at scale.

articles.title: Three cubs born at MP's Kuno National Park, push India’s cheetah count to 38
articles.summary: Three cubs were born to South African cheetah Gamini at Madhya Pradesh’s Kuno National Park, taking India’s total to 38 and marking the ninth litter under Project Cheetah.

articles.title: India can lead AI adoption, jobs will change across sectors: Google's James Manyika
articles.summary: Google's James Manyika said at the India AI Impact Summit 2026 that India can lead global AI adoption by investing in skills, infrastructure and innovation while managing job transitions across sectors.

articles.title: Kia Seltos crosses 6 lakh sales in India; top variants account for 29%
articles.summary: Kia India said the Seltos has crossed 6 lakh cumulative sales since its 2019 launch, with top variants contributing 29%, as demand for safety, technology and premium features lifts mid-SUV sales.

articles.title: FOAID 2025 highlights | The best architecture and interior design conference and exhibition in India
articles.summary: FOAID 2025 in New Delhi and Mumbai sparked India’s architectural revolution, bringing visionaries together at multiple design events and forums.

articles.title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: TCS introduces AI-guided loom for Kanjivaram sari weaving
articles.summary: At the India AI Impact Summit 2026, TCS demonstrated an AI-powered sari design system using LED-guided looms to reduce errors and speed up weaving.

articles.title: Gold jewellery reported missing from Punjab National Bank locker in Delhi’s Kirti Nagar
articles.summary: Delhi Police are investigating missing gold jewellery from a Punjab National Bank locker in Tagore Market, Kirti Nagar. No signs of forced entry found; CCTV and records are being examined.

articles.title: Delhi Dwarka crash: Father of teen SUV driver apologises, says family will cooperate with probe
articles.summary: Sahil Dhaneshra died in a Dwarka crash caused by a minor driving an SUV. The accused’s father apologised, pledged legal cooperation, and clarified vehicle ownership.

articles.title: Modi meets Google CEO Sundar Pichai at India AI Impact Summit in Delhi
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai in New Delhi during the India AI Impact Summit 2026, where global leaders are discussing AI governance, safety and growth.

articles.title: 'India not arriving at the future but helping define it': Serbian President praises India’s AI leadership
articles.summary: Vučić recalls his early days working in London, where he befriended Indians who taught him about perseverance and dignity.

articles.title: Delhi wakes up to light rain, IMD issues yellow alert; showers expected in these states too
articles.summary: Delhi NCR saw light showers and cloudy skies on February 18 as IMD issued a yellow alert. Isolated rainfall with thunderstorm, lightning & gusty winds is also likely over Nicobar, Haryana, Rajasthan on February 18, with thunderstorm & lightning likely over West Madhya Pradesh as well.

articles.title: AI creates new roles even as it disrupts old ones, say startups at India AI Summit
articles.summary: At the India AI Impact Summit, AI’s real-world impact took centre stage as startups showcased how the technology is reshaping industries. Coursera highlighted how AI is changing jobs and driving large-scale upskilling, while Pocket FM demonstrated how AI is transforming content creation and storytelling. Together, they reflect how Indian startups are using AI not just to disrupt, but to build scalable and practical solutions.

articles.title: Galgotias University apologises for Chinese robodog fiasco, blames rep
articles.summary: Galgotias University apologised for displaying the Chinese Unitree Go2 robotic dog as Orion at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, clarifying it was for academic use and not indigenously developed.

articles.title: From AIIMS to Sarvam, Google CEO Pichai underscores AI rise in India
articles.summary: At the India AI Impact Summit 2026, Sundar Pichai underscored AI’s sweeping impact across sectors, while praising India’s innovation ecosystem, from Flipkart and OYO to Sarvam AI’s newly-launched homegrown foundational models.

articles.title: Google’s Pichai backs India’s AI leap with schools push, research fund and US tie-up
articles.summary: At the India AI Impact Summit, Sundar Pichai said India can “leapfrog” in AI, announced a $30 million global research challenge and outlined fresh US–India connectivity and education initiatives.

articles.title: SarvamAI launches chat platform 'Samvaad' at India AI Impact Summit
articles.summary: SarvamAI launched Samvaad at the India AI Impact Summit, offering conversational AI in 22 Indian languages.

articles.title: India’s AI advantage lies in scale and adoption, not compute power: Qualcomm CEO
articles.summary: Cristiano Amon, President & CEO of Qualcomm, expressed strong optimism about India's potential to become a leading AI nation, drawing parallels with its rapid smartphone and digital payment adoption. He believes AI will profoundly empower people, creating an 'economy of agents'.

articles.title: AI-led efficiency gains may drive higher enterprise tech spends: Tech Mahindra
articles.summary: Sham Arora, Chief Technology Officer at Tech Mahindra, said that fears around widespread disruption in the SaaS industry may be overstated. He explained that core systems of record will remain essential, but AI will significantly transform the workflows and user experiences built on top of these platforms.

articles.title: AI moves to kitchens: This appliance turns kitchen waste into soil in hours
articles.summary: With India generating nearly 62 million tonnes of waste annually, a Bengaluru startup is pitching AI as a solution inside the home. Its device, unveiled at the AI Impact Summit, converts daily kitchen waste into nutrient-rich soil in under two days.

articles.title: India AI summit: Someone with 15–20 years of experience risks becoming 'unemployable', says Vinod Khosla
articles.summary: Vinod Khosla remarked at the India AI Impact Summit 2026 in New Delhi that the employment scenario will be clear by 2050.

articles.title: Indian startups turn their focus towards building AI tools that solve real-world problems
articles.summary: Indian startups are focusing on practical AI tools that solve real problems, as investors and founders back scalable, real-world applications over experimental or hype-driven ideas.

articles.title: Amazon doubles down on India with fresh $35 billion investment through 2030
articles.summary: David Zapolsky, Chief Global Affairs & Legal Officer at Amazon, said more than 100,000 businesses in India are already using the company’s cloud services, and Amazon aims to make AI access seamless for enterprises and governments. He added that given India’s scale and digital adoption, it ranks among the top global markets for future expansion.

articles.title: AI may threaten 7% of jobs, complement 17%: World Bank VP for AI
articles.summary: Sangbu Kim of World Bank says generative AI may risk 7 percent of jobs but complement 17 percent. India’s talent and Digital Public Infrastructure position it as a global AI leader and test bed.

articles.title: PM Modi: India must be among top 3 global AI superpowers
articles.summary: In an interview with ANI, PM Narendra Modi outlined India’s ambitious AI roadmap, stressing human-centric technology, Aatmanirbhar Bharat in AI and a goal to make India a top three global AI superpower.

articles.title: Fathom bets big on AI trust market, sees India as key growth hub
articles.summary: Fathom Co-Founder Andrew Freedman says India is becoming central to the company’s expansion strategy, with growing focus on AI applications and data layers, even as core LLM development remains concentrated in the United States.

articles.title: Study shows nearly half of small-cap stocks are 40% below highs: What it means for your portfolio
articles.summary: Abakkus Mutual Fund finds half of India’s small-cap stocks are 40% below highs. Small-caps grew 5.3x since 2019, with higher returns and volatility.

articles.title: Gold, silver ease in India: Key factors behind Monday’s fall
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices in India fell on MCX amid weak global trends, thin trading due to Presidents Day and Lunar New Year, profit-booking, and geopolitical tensions involving USS Gerald R. Ford.

articles.summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai said the $15 billion AI hub in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, will house a gigawatt-scale compute facility and an international subsea cable gateway.

articles.title: “End-to-end AI” films are here: Kuku’s AI Impact summit demo hints at a content flood
articles.summary: At AI Impact Summit 2026 at Bharat Mandapam, Lal Chand Bisu, CEO of Kuku FM, unveiled what he described as India’s first “AI-first micro drama”

articles.summary: YourStory presents the daily news roundup from the Indian startup ecosystem and beyond. Here's the roundup for Wednesday, February 18, 2026.

articles.title: How a Fatehpur entrepreneur brought mumbai street food to his city
articles.summary: Mohammad Naushad from Fatehpur district did come from a business family. Based in Khalil Nagar in the city area, he spent years working in sales

articles.title: Oil edges higher as traders weigh progress in US-Iran talks
articles.summary: Iran conducted military drills near the Strait of Hormuz. Navy drills are planned with Russia. US crude oil stockpiles are expected to rise. Peace talks between Ukraine and Russia are underway.

articles.summary: Government compensation for cooking gas sales also contributed to the improved financial performance. This marks a substantial gain for the state-run energy giants.

articles.summary: This article is authored by Col Rajeev Agarwal (Rtd), senior research consultant, CRF.

articles.title: 'Estonia using AI smartly by building trust between govts and societies'
articles.summary: Estonia offers its experience in societal digitalization and building trust in AI to India and the world. The nation has successfully moved most services online, enhancing efficiency and citizen convenience. Estonia also emphasizes collaborative efforts in AI education for students and teachers, aiming for smart AI integration.

articles.title: Rajya Sabha polls on March 16, BJP-led NDA tally to go up
articles.summary: The NDA, which is in power in 6 of the 10 states which are voting for the Upper House, has 134 members in the Rajya Sabha, where the strength currently is 243.

articles.title: Yotta to invest $2bn for AI hub with top Nvidia chips
articles.summary: India is set to host one of Asia's largest AI superclusters with Yotta Data Services investing $2 billion to deploy over 20,000 Nvidia Blackwell Ultra GPUs by August 2026. This move addresses a critical compute gap in India's AI ecosystem, with a focus on inferencing to support scaled AI applications for millions.

articles.title: PM Modi to speak at opening ceremony of India AI Impact Summit at 10:25am
articles.summary: The India AI Impact Summit 2026 is being held in Delhi from February 16 to February 20, the first global AI Summit being hosted in the Global South.

articles.title: India is a blueprint for democratising AI globally, Sundar Pichai says
articles.summary: Google has unveiled a plethora of AI initiatives for a country that's home to the world's largest internet population outside of China.

articles.title: Survey: Kids use AI daily, but most don't know how it works
articles.summary: A recent survey reveals that 35% of Indian children using edtech tools are now employing Generative AI, with a significant misconception that these tools are merely search engines. Despite high usage, especially among low-income households, a lack of AI literacy poses risks, as 46% of respondents identified "wrong information" as a key concern.

articles.title: Child-lifting rumours fuel MP mob attacks
articles.summary: A disturbing surge in mob violence, fueled by child-lifting rumors, has led to innocent individuals being attacked across Madhya Pradesh. In Indore, a mentally ill woman was assaulted, and similar panic-driven attacks are occurring without any evidence of actual kidnappings. Police urge citizens to report suspicions rather than taking the law into their own hands.

articles.title: Amit Shah skips SIR talk in Matua outreach at West Bengal event
articles.summary: Home Minister Amit Shah visited Mayapur, the birthplace of the Bhakti movement, to highlight the Matua community's role in unifying Hindu society. He praised reformers Harichand and Guruchand Thakur for their social welfare initiatives and described Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati as a bridge to modernity. Shah conveyed PM Modi's greetings, emphasizing the spread of the 'Viksit Bharat' and Sanatan dharma messages globally.

articles.title: AGI 5-10 yrs away, science to surge, jobs to shift: Hassabis
articles.summary: Google DeepMind's Demis Hassabis believes Artificial General Intelligence is a decade away, emphasizing its role in scientific breakthroughs rather than job displacement. He urged India to leverage AI in its strong sectors and advised youth to embrace AI tools. Hassabis highlighted AI's potential to accelerate scientific discovery, citing AlphaFold as an example, and cautioned about dual-use risks like cyber threats.

articles.title: Goyal: India keen to diversify crude, coking coal sources
articles.summary: India is actively seeking to broaden its crude oil and coking coal suppliers, with a keen interest in high-quality US coking coal. Minister Piyush Goyal highlighted the US's potential to provide crucial technology like GPUs for AI and data center equipment, while India offers manufacturing prowess. Significant aircraft demand from the US also presents a key opportunity.

articles.title: 'Quite ridiculous': Piyush Goyal dismisses investor fears over future of India’s IT sector
India eyes diversification of crude oil sources; Piyush Goyal says would ‘love’ high-quality coking coal from US
